name: The Upper House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Effortless in every way. Speedy check in, speedier checkout, fantastic service, really top class. This hotel now had me as a regular
reviews.title: Class act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although no pool, the gym is of adequate size with good modern equipment. Breakfast from level 49 is spot on, again with impeccable service.
reviews.title: Exquisite experience from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing experience. From the time of booking to a post stay email from the team at Upper House I was hugely impressed with all elements of the service. The hotel manages to combine great service, beautifully appointed rooms, and excellent restaurants and facilities. In my experience there is usully one element that lets hotels of this caliber down, but not here.
reviews.title: I wish we could have stayed forever! Faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for an all too short single night but the staff attention to detail was superb, and we were constantly made to feel special. As soon as I booked (only a few days in advance) the account manager sent me an email asking if there was anything I needed (I had indicated that it was our wedding night), and later informed me that as we would be coming back late she had extended our check out time. Upon arriving at the hotel the staff wished us both well and when we got to the room we had been upgraded to an Upper Suite, which was totally gorgeous. When we left to go to the wedding party they drove us there in the hotel car as there were no taxis. This would still be a 5* review without the room upgrade because they get so many other things right as well. There is not much I can add to the other reviews on this sight to give more insight, just join the ranks of a happy, blown away by the whole experience, group of customers.
reviews.title: Sublime Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: Young,enthusiastic,professional team delivering a memorable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to end The Upper House exceeded the expectations of my partner and I. We stayed for a romantic long weekend in May and enjoyed the views, service, facilities and location of the hotel. The only disappointment was the service received from the sommelier on the night we decided to eat at the restaurant on the top level. Her service was so out of step with the rest of the hotel, we were shocked. Don’t let it deter you from staying, but is a definite area for improvement.
reviews.title: The Upper House... the Upper Echelon of Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me address the only disappointment, as the rest of the review is glowing. The sommelier... On the night we weren’t chasing dims sums (see below), we ate at the hotel restaurant. Panoramic views of the city and harbour! Fantastic food! Extensive and impressive wine list! So we decided to enlist the services of the sommelier to navigate. She asked us for our wine preferences, meal selection and went off to prepare a matched wine for each of our courses. This is where it went downhill, the first wine was exactly what we asked not to have, but was a favourite of hers. Round two... déjà vu! After we very politely reminded her of our preferences, she returned with replacement wines this time and provided tasting measures. Before we could taste she walked off and was not seen again, before even filling our glasses. We felt, realising her tip was no longer with us, she shunned our table and provided no further service. We had to seek the help of other waiters to top the glasses and provide the remaining wines with our meals. To say the least, we were very disappointed and would expect much better considering the prices we paid for the wine!
reviews.title: Just enjoyed our second stay at The Upper House!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, on to the good stuff...We considered many hotels before picking The Upper House, and decided to stay there primarily based on views on tripadvisor. Upon booking the hotel we were contacted by their staff to see if we had any special requirements/needs. My partner responded seeking to understand the gluten-free menu options and confirming gym facilities. Both addressed and responded to by the hotel.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted at the airport and ferried to the hotel in style (the car even had wi-fi!), taken to our room (which was upgraded to a suite) and checked in by a very friendly chap. A specially prepared gluten-free menu was shared with us, along with freshly baked snacks to make us feel welcomed.
reviews.title: This is a wow hotel. Not for young families though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by describing the room in a single word... fantastic! Every room had views of the harbour, including the shower and bath which was the stuff elite travel magazines are made of! The bath was detached in the centre of the room, a sneaky TV hidden in the mirror, a large selection of bath salts, oils, etc. Very romantic laying back and watching the lights of Hong Kong flicker in the distance and the ships float by. The person checking us in summed it up well... the suite was bigger than his family’s home!
reviews.title: An Amazing Start to an Amazing Adventure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: A bit of a late review, but I stayed at this incredible property in November 2012.
reviews.title: You can't beat this in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: As a family, we travel to Hong Kong quite regularly, and have usually stayed on the Kowloon side. For a change, I decided to try out the Hong Kong island side, and The Upper House was very highly recommended by both friends and tripadvisor.
reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The great experience starts even before you actually get to the hotel. They will send you an email before your stay, to find out if there is anything they can help you with or provide in the room. So they made sure that the room was prepared before you get there, and in our case, that was to have a baby cot and a DVD player in the room (the DVD player isn't standard in the room, but if you request for one, they'll provide one for you.) They helped us make several restaurant bookings as well.
reviews.title: Small, Quite, and Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I'm sure many would know already, the hotel actually occupies the top few floors of a building in which the rest is JW Marriot. The entrance to the hotel is quite unassuming, and if you didn't know, you'd think it was an entrance to some residences or office building. There were just 3 or 4 counters, where you let them know who you are, and they'll get someone to accompany you to your room to process the check in. There was a nice big Christmas tree in the lobby, and when they saw my little girl just staring at the small soft toys hanging from the branches as decoration, they gladly let her choose 1 to keep. Great service!
reviews.title: views to die for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were upgraded to an Upper Suite, and this room is one of the best I've ever stayed in. It was huge, and the views were absolutely amazing. I really can't find any fault in the room at all (ok, having a bath with a view would be great, but highly discouraged as people outside can see in too!) Floor to ceiling windows throughout the rooms and bath room. 3 large sofas to lounge on (or in the case of my daughter, climb and run around.) A free minibar that is topped up everyday. The minibar had biscuits, small packs of M&Ms, soft drinks. Toiletries were topped up everyday as well, and they encourage you to keep the small toiletry bag even. They provide duffel bags and umbrellas for use as well, all in a huge cupboard.
reviews.title: Best hotel i've stayed this year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Upper House in Hong Kong Island for 4 nights last week. This was my 3rd stay there. Unfortunately, I picked a period which was very busy for almost all the top hotels in Hong Kong (try to avoid the last two weeks of September till the first two weeks of October if you can) and hence, the prices were "sky high" (about 15-25% more than during the less busy period).
reviews.title: Still excellent, though has room for improvement, and very expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013

reviews.title: Looking forward to next stay at Upper House!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family

reviews.title: Gorgeous views, great staff, gorgeous rooms - and products

aka: The Upper House Hotel Hong Kong
description: The Upper House is a highly individualized small luxury hotel designed by Hong Kong architect Andre Fu. The hotel’s 117 rooms (including 21 suites and 2 penthouses) start at 730sq ft – the largest in Hong Kong. They feature wonderfully spacious bathrooms and dressing areas, and offer either scenic harbour or island views. Calming and contemporary, the rooms are designed to provide a sense of relaxation, warmth and understated luxury.
